intro: Calophaca wolgarica var. tianschanica, commonly known as the Tianshan calophaca, is a flowering plant native to the Tianshan mountain range in Central Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf structures and often showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually simple and alternate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in early summer, contributing to its ecological significance in high-altitude ecosystems.
